item.title: 5 years after anti-police protests, initiatives for officer mental health have traction
item.description: Efforts to improve officers' mental health have grown over the past five years. They were sparked in part by the death of George Floyd, which prompted a wave of anti- police protests.

item.title: A small Montana town grapples with the fallouts from federal worker cuts
item.description: Science is an economic driver in Hamilton, Mont., thanks to Rocky Mountain Laboratories, a federal research lab. Now, layoffs and funding cuts are having an impact in this town far from Washington.

item.title: The CFPB wanted medical debt to be left off credit reports. That's changed under Trump
item.description: Under the Biden administration, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau finalized a rule barring medical debt from appearing on credit reports. Now, the agency is siding with the credit industry groups suing to have the rule vacated.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Using an app to rate food for nutrition? Take the results with a grain of salt
item.description: Food apps can help you figure out what's in your food and whether it's nutritious. Just scan the barcode on the packet with your phone. But different apps can give very different results. Here's why.

item.title: U.S.-German citizen is charged with trying to attack the U.S. Embassy in Tel Aviv
item.description: A dual U.S.-German citizen has been arrested on charges that he traveled to Israel and attempted to firebomb the branch office of the U.S. Embassy in Tel Aviv, officials said Sunday.
